## Module 11

### 11.3 Functions

The general format for a function as follows: function_name \<- function(<argument list>) {

}

Arguments are separated by commas \### 11.4 Conditional Expressions Used foor "flow control" to structure what your program does when. the most common conditional exprression os the "if... else..." used to direct flow of a program between two paths

the general format: if(<test>){ \<action 1\> } else{ \<action 2\> } \#### example

```{r}
i <- TRUE

if (i == TRUE) {
    print("Yes")
} else {
    print("No")
}
```

# Module 12

### Population

all of the elements from a set of data (e.g., all of the gorillas in the world) = N

### Sample -

one or more observations drawn from a population by some kind of sampling process (e.g., the set of gorillas living in Rwanda, the set of gorilla skeletons found in a museum) = n
